lst.name: sentence
lst.str: A budget bureau official said the bureau still wanted to stick with its so-called "minus-ceiling" policy, which calls for government departments to reduce investment spending by five pct a year.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: That means the government should have more than enough money in the fiscal year ending next March to pay for the planned tax cuts without having recourse to the unpopular tax measures proposed by Nakasone, one official said.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The higher than expected revenues in 1986/87 partly stemmed from increased receipts from land and securities taxes, as prices of both shares and land soared, one official said.
